modern: When someone says 'She's thirsty, ain't she?', they're implying she's seeking attention.
shakespearean: When one remarks, "She doth crave attention, doth she not?", they suggest her desire for notice.

modern: Saying 'He's flexing those dollar bills.' means he's showing off his wealth.
shakespearean: To utter, "He doth flaunt his gold coins, verily." is to say he parades his riches.

modern: The phrase 'That's some tea.' refers to juicy gossip or interesting news.
shakespearean: The saying, 'That's a tale most intriguing.' speaks of a story that piques interest.

modern: Exclaiming 'It's lit!' means the situation is exciting or fun.
shakespearean: Declaring 'It's a merry revel!' signifies a joyous occasion.

modern: When someone uses 'Throwing shade', they're subtly expressing disapproval or contempt.
shakespearean: When one says "Casting aspersions", they art discreetly showing disdain or scorn.

modern: The term 'No cap' is used to emphasize that someone is not lying.
shakespearean: The phrase "In sooth, no falsehood" is uttered to stress that one speaks the truth.

modern: To 'Slide into the DMs' means to send someone a direct message, usually with romantic intent.
shakespearean: To "Venture into private missives" is to send a personal letter, perchance with courtly designs.

modern: If someone has 'Ghosted', they've suddenly cut off all communication without explanation.
shakespearean: If one hath 'Vanish'd like a spectre', they've abruptly ceased all discourse without reason.

modern: The phrase 'On fleek' means that something is perfect or flawless.
shakespearean: The saying 'In finest fettle' signifies that something is in impeccable condition.

modern: I cannot stop talking about my crush, he lives in my head rent-free!
shakespearean: I cease not to speak of my fancy; he doth dwell in my thoughts without cost.

modern: What do you think of this slip dress? It’s giving 90s pop-star.

modern: This pizza is bussin’, it’s so yummy!

modern: Why are you acting sus? I think you’re up to something.
shakespearean: Wherefore dost thou behave so dubiously? Methinks thou art contriving something.

modern: ICYMI, here’s a link to his article from last week.

shakespearean: Verily, I have achieved an A+ on mine examination. Huzzah!

shakespearean: Pray, do not insult him thus; he doth revel in merriment.

modern: Why you trippin' over a little thing like that?
shakespearean: Wherefore dost thou vex thyself over such a trifle?

modern: You really rock at playing the guitar, man!
shakespearean: Thou art truly excellent in the art of the guitar, my good sir!

modern: Hey dude, check out this cool video.
shakespearean: Greetings, friend; behold this entertaining spectacle.

modern: If they mess with me one more time, I might just go postal.
shakespearean: Should they provoke me again, I may embark on a furious rampage.

modern: Let's dip from this party; it's getting boring.
shakespearean: Let us take our leave from this festivity; it doth lack mirth.

modern: I'm heading back to the crib to chill.
shakespearean: I shall return to my abode to relax and unwind.

modern: Those sneakers are phat; I gotta get a pair.
shakespearean: Those shoes are splendid; I must acquire a pair.

modern: That excuse is totally bogus; nobody believes it.
shakespearean: Verily, that excuse is false; no one hath faith in it.

modern: I'm gonna psych him out with a fake ghost story.
shakespearean: I shall disconcert him with a fabricated tale of spirits.

modern: What's up, homeslice? Haven't seen you in a minute.
shakespearean: Greetings, dear friend; 'tis been a while since we last crossed paths.

modern: Stay woke and be aware of the issues.
shakespearean: Stay vigilant and be informed of the matters at hand.

modern: I hate adulting; I just want to be a kid forever.
shakespearean: I abhor the burdens of adulthood; I simply wish to remain a child in perpetuity.

modern: She's cancelled, I can't deal with her drama anymore.
shakespearean: She is dismissed, for I can no longer endure her theatrics.

modern: Always keep it 100 and stay true to yourself.
shakespearean: Always uphold your honor and remain loyal to thine own self.

modern: The aesthetic of this artwork is truly remarkable.
shakespearean: The artistic beauty of this masterpiece is verily extraordinary.

modern: That selfie is such a thirst trap.
shakespearean: That self-portrait doth ensnare desire and seek admiration.

modern: This song gives me all the feels.
shakespearean: This melody overwhelms me with profound emotions.

modern: He's been hitting the gym, and now he's swol.
shakespearean: He hath frequented the exercise hall, and now he's grown robustly muscular.

modern: I'm literally dying of laughter.
shakespearean: I am, in a manner of speaking, perishing from laughter.

modern: You're my bae, and I love you.
shakespearean: Thou art my beloved, and I hold deep affection for thee.

modern: Her taste is so basic; she only likes popular stuff.
shakespearean: Her preferences are exceedingly mundane; she favors only well-known things.

modern: She always humblebrags about her achievements.
shakespearean: She habitually boasts while feigning modesty about her accomplishments.

modern: Bye Felicia, I've had enough of your nonsense.
shakespearean: Farewell, Felicia; I've endured your folly long enough.

modern: She slays on the runway with her fashion sense.
shakespearean: She excels on the catwalk with her keen fashion sensibilities.

modern: I ship those two characters in the show; they'd be cute together.
shakespearean: I hold hope for a romantic union betwixt those two fictional personas in the drama; they would make an enchanting pair.

modern: Cheugy phrases be like, totally outdated.
shakespearean: Cheugy expressions doth resemble, completely antiquated.

modern: I got mad FOMO seeing their party on Instagram.
shakespearean: I harbored great fear of missing out whilst beholding their revelry on Instagram.

modern: He's big mad 'cause he lost the game.
shakespearean: He's exceedingly wrathful for he hath suffered defeat in the contest.

modern: She thinks she's all boujee, but she's not fooling anyone.
shakespearean: She perceiveth herself as high-class, yet she deceives no one.

modern: Quit cappin', tell the truth!
shakespearean: Cease thy falsehoods, speak the truth!

modern: She knows how to beat her face for the night out.
shakespearean: She hath the skill to adorn her visage for the evening's merriment.

modern: Fam, you always got my back.
shakespearean: Dear friend, thou art ever trustworthy and loyal.

modern: You wanna catch these hands, bruh?
shakespearean: Dost thou wish to engage in fisticuffs, good sir?

modern: Highkey, that party was lit!
shakespearean: Verily, that celebration was most splendid!

modern: Karen demanded to speak with the manager again.
shakespearean: Karen didst insist on an audience with the supervisor once more.

modern: I love that for you. (Said with sarcasm)
shakespearean: I doth adore that for thee. (Said with irony)

modern: Mood. It's been a long week.
shakespearean: Aye, I can relate. This week hath been arduous.

modern: That celebrity is a snack!
shakespearean: That celebrity is a delectable morsel!

modern: I stan that singer; their music is amazing.
shakespearean: I am an ardent admirer of that minstrel; their melodies are wondrous.

modern: That excuse sounds sus, don't you think?
shakespearean: That excuse doth sound suspicious, dost thou not agree?
